comment: Nagai Sensei was a really sweet teacher and made learning the language fun and engaging. However, it was hard to communicate difficult questions sometimes and her style of teaching is very fast-paced. Lots of homework and it really adds up. Exams were much harder than 1001 in my opinion. Highly recommend utilizing the tutor for this course.

This is a language course, expect to have to learn the language. There's homework due every couple days, and 1 or 2 quizzes a week. Exams are straightforward and match the homework and study guides. Grades are spread out between many things (good). Class performance is 15%, grading is kind of random. Raise your hand and do your best, it'll be fine.

Prof. Nagai is honestly a very sweet lady, but her class is the exact opposite. There is a quiz/test every week and you need to study every day to make a decent grade in her class. All teaching material comes from the textbook and there's homework due every other day. The class was fun and all, but I would definitely not do it again.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She gives a LOT of HW. She asks questions during class time. Still an F with late submissions usually. Participation grade is based on her liking. Quizzes usually every week(often) twice a week (not online). Grades based on handwriting. Very fast-paced. Expects you to speak fluent Japanese.
Very nice and understanding BUT will not work with you if you dont communicate. Text book and work book is a must! She posts her PowerPoints after each class.
Nagai-sensei is extremely passionate about Japanese culture and the language. The only problem this gave me was her pacing. I would constantly be asking myself if I missed something sometimes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I love Nagai-sensei. She is incredibly kind and funny, and really wants all her students to do well. She is extremely clear about when all assignments are due. Tests are easy if you do the homework and pay attention in class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I liked this class. straightforward. There's almost always homework due, which is good because you stay in a routine. The schedule is given right at the start so you know what to expect. Make sure to teach yourself Katakana! I missed one class and it seriously got me behind. It is possible to catch up though. Go to class, do the work, participate!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She has the whole semester's activities on a schedule on the first day. She really likes in-class participation and quizzes (beginning of the class, usually 12 quick questions about the things taught on the week). There is usually homework to do but very rarely is a heavy amount (most of my classmates used to do them on the 30 min. before class).
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Nagai sensei is fantastic! She is a kind, excellent teacher. Lots of in-class practice helps make learning the language much easier. As long as you practice a lot (reading, writing, and speaking), you will do wonderfully. Her course is fun and challenging in a wonderful way. I'm taking her again next semester!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Would take again

comment: Great teacher who gives workbook pages almost every class(sounds like a lot but it makes you learn it) If you keep up with the alphabets and vocab it should be a pretty easy class. There is a lot of in class practice with the people around you. There are many extra credit opportunities for this class to help such as a short culture presentation.

Nagai sensei is very well organized and has exceptionally well structured lectures that are helpful and easy to follow. She has a friendly, cheerful personality that makes class enjoyable and she clearly enjoys helping students learn Japanese. Do all the homework and make sure to practice outside of class and you'll do well. Lots of extra credit.

Nagai sensei is very caring and wants the students to do well. There is a lot of homework, and some people complain because they don't want to do it, but we have it to help learn Japanese. The homework is for completion and the quizzes are easy. We have skits that take some work, but as we go up in course level the level of the classes increases.

Nagai sensei is fantastic!  She livens up her lectures with games and activities that make the class way more fun.  She always reviews before tests and quizzes, which is really helpful.  I can't wait to take her for JPN 1002.

Great professor. Does lots of in class reviewing, even before tests! Quizes & tests are timed. Heavy on in-class participation. Lots of HW, but graded mostly on effort. Tons of quizes! She tries to keep the class fun with amusing PPT's, songs, games, etc. Offers bonus points frequently! Graded on: tests, quizes, recordings, skits, partcipation.
